alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Franklin; Mercer; Scott; Woodford (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 03 at 10:53PM EDT until September 04 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Louisville has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Eastern Anderson County in central Kentucky... Eastern Franklin County in central Kentucky... Central Mercer County in central Kentucky... Southwestern Scott County in central Kentucky... Woodford County in central Kentucky... * Until 200 AM EDT. * At 1053 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Frankfort, Lawrenceburg, Versailles, Ballard, Midway, Stamping Ground, Milner, Tyrone, Clifton and Ninevah. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
